abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Technical Assistance Water Sector Reform Project St.
            Lucia, which improves the institutional performance of the
            water and sewerage sector. Temporary environmental impacts
            and their mitigation measures are as follows: Disruption of
            recreational, commercial, and industrial activities
            including the destruction of crops in the path of pipelines
            will be minimized by coordinating the construction schedule
            with local stakeholders, and providing temporary access to
            relevant facilities. Traffic will be managed by developing
            detour routes, limiting construction during peak tourist
            season, restricting delivery times and places, protecting
            walkways and safeguarding trenches, repairing and
            maintaining all surface damage to roads. Noise pollution and
            vibration will be controlled by maintaining mechanical
            equipment, and avoiding construction at night and on
            weekends. Dust and silt on properties adjacent to
            construction will reduced by damping down areas and using
            wheel cleaners for construction vehicles. Air pollution will
            be mitigated by maintaining construction vehicles and
            minimizing their movement. Reinstate cleared land and
            maintain vegetative cover on reinstated land. Steps will be
            taken to avoid the accidental destruction of archaeological
            sites during construction. Spills and leaks will be
            expeditiously cleaned and clean-up materials disposed in a landfill.
